name: eAtlas Data Catalogue
description: A website and mapping system for presenting environmental research data in an accessible form that promotes greater use of this information. The eAtlas aims to promote collaboration and support the work of management agencies, researchers, reef-based industries, and community groups. It serves as the primary data and knowledge repository for multiple environmental projects, covering topics such as seagrass, coral reefs, turtles, dugongs, seabirds, bathymetry, fish abundance, Crown Of Thorns Starfish, rainforest revegetation, wet tropics species distributions, etc.
